title: Quiz 5: Health Promotion & Infection Control
topicName: Essential Knowledge and Skills for Healthcare Assistants
description: Assess knowledge on healthy living advice, smoking/alcohol, and infection prevention principles.

questions.question: Order the stages of the 'Cycle of Change' (Prochaska & Di Clemente):
questions.explanation: The cycle moves from not thinking about it (Pre-contemplation) -> Thinking (Contemplation) -> Preparing -> Doing (Action) -> Sticking to it (Maintenance) -> Slipping back (Relapse).

questions.question: According to current guidelines, what is the maximum recommended weekly alcohol unit intake for both men and women?
questions.explanation: Men and women should drink no more than 14 units a week spread evenly over several days.
questions.hint: It's the same number for men and women now.

questions.question: Match the component of the Chain of Infection with its example:

pairs.right: Person, animal, or object where it lives

questions.explanation: Correctly links the links in the chain of infection.
questions.hint: Agent is the bug; Reservoir is where it lives.

questions.question: Which of the following are defined as 'Key Moments for Hand Hygiene' by the WHO? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The 5 moments are: Before patient contact, Before aseptic task, After body fluid exposure, After patient contact, After contact with surroundings.
questions.hint: Does reading notes involve infection risk?

questions.question: Infection is caused by microorganisms. ___BLANK___ flora are easily removed by hand washing, whereas ___BLANK___ flora live deeper in the skin and are harder to remove.
questions.explanation: Transient flora (on surface) are the main cause of cross-infection and wash off easily. Resident flora live deeper.
questions.hint: One is just passing through; the other lives there.

questions.question: Gloves are a complete substitute for hand washing; you do not need to wash hands if you wear them.
questions.explanation: Gloves are NOT a substitute. Hands must be decontaminated before and after glove use. Gloves can have microscopic holes or contaminate hands on removal.
questions.hint: Can bacteria get through or onto hands when removing gloves?

questions.question: Which historical figure first identified hand decontamination as a way to reduce mortality in obstetric clinics?
questions.explanation: Semmelweis discovered that medical students washing hands in chlorinated lime reduced death rates.

questions.question: What is the recommended amount of physical activity for adults per week (moderate intensity)?
questions.explanation: Adults should aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate activity per week.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of stopping smoking? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Smoking cessation improves fertility, skin, and energy. Weight gain is actually a common (though manageable) withdrawal side effect.

questions.question: Alcohol hand rub is suitable for use when hands are visibly soiled/dirty.
questions.explanation: If hands are visibly dirty or contaminated with organic matter, they MUST be washed with soap and water. Gel won't work through dirt.
questions.hint: Can gel clean off mud or blood?
